# ODS-E Documentation
> Open Data Schema for Energy — a minimal, interoperable contract for energy asset data exchange across OEMs, markets, and analytics platforms.

## Learn
- [What is ODS-E?](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/what-is-odse): Overview of ODS-E, its goals, and what problems it solves.
- [Why ODS-E?](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/why-odse): Motivation and comparison to alternatives.
- [Architecture & Core Concepts](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/concepts/architecture): Data flow diagram and how transforms, validation, and enrichment compose.

## Build
- [Quickstart](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/build/quickstart): Install, transform one CSV, validate the output — 3 steps.
- [Multi-OEM Transform Tutorial](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/tutorials/multi-oem-transform): Transform data from 3 OEMs side-by-side and compare output.
- [Bring Your Own Data](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/tutorials/bring-your-own-data): Use the generic CSV mapper with your own files.
- [Data Engineer Integration Guide](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/guides/data-engineers): Pipeline patterns for ETL teams — SCADA to Parquet.
- [CLI Walkthrough](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/guides/cli-walkthrough): Every odse CLI command with real examples.
- [Transforms Overview](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/transforms/overview): How transforms normalize OEM data into ODS-E records.
- [Supported OEMs](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/transforms/supported-oems): Support matrix for all 10 OEM connectors.
- [Validation Overview](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/validation/overview): Schema, semantic, and profile validation.

## Patterns
- [Basic: Transform + Validate](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/patterns/basic-transform-validate): Transform OEM CSV, validate, write to JSON — complete working code.
- [Trading Settlement Pipeline](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/patterns/trading-settlement-pipeline): Transform, enrich with market context, validate against a conformance profile.
- [Building Energy Benchmarking](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/patterns/building-energy-benchmarking): Join ODS-E timeseries to ComStock benchmarks for EUI ratio analysis.
- [LLM RAG with ODS-E Metadata](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/patterns/llm-rag-with-odse-metadata): Use ODS-E metadata for structured RAG filtering in energy LLM apps.

## Reference
- [Schema Overview](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/schemas/overview): How the energy-timeseries and asset-metadata schemas relate.
- [Energy Timeseries](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/schemas/energy-timeseries): Required and optional fields for interval energy records.
- [Asset Metadata](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/schemas/asset-metadata): Fields for asset context — location, capacity, asset type, grid connection.
- [Grid Capacity](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/schemas/grid-capacity): Grid connection lifecycle, allocated capacity, and GCAR milestones.
- [Inverter API Access](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/schemas/inverter-api-access): API onboarding requirements for inverter OEMs used by transforms.
- [Python SDK Reference](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/reference/python-sdk): Full API documentation for all public functions.
- [Schema Validation](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/validation/schema-validation): Structural correctness rules for ODS-E records.
- [Semantic Validation](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/validation/semantic-validation): Physical plausibility checks — capacity bounds, state consistency.
- [Conformance Profiles](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/validation/conformance-profiles): Required-field sets for specific SA trading contexts.

## Trading Integration
- [Enrichment](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/trading-integration/enrichment): Inject settlement, tariff, and topology context post-transform.
- [Wheeling Extensions](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/trading-integration/wheeling-extensions): Standard envelope for traditional, virtual, and portfolio wheeling.
- [Tariff Unbundling](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/trading-integration/tariff-unbundling): Granular unbundled tariff component fields at the interval level.
- [Curtailment Tracking](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/trading-integration/curtailment-tracking): Track curtailment events, causes, and estimated lost generation.
- [BRP / Imbalance Settlement](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/trading-integration/brp-imbalance-settlement): BRP context, forecasts, and imbalance calculations.
- [Municipal Reconciliation](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/trading-integration/municipal-reconciliation): Billing cycles, metered vs billed quantities, DAA references.
- [Green Attributes](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/trading-integration/green-attributes): Renewable energy certificate references and carbon intensity.
- [User-Managed ID Registries](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/trading-integration/user-managed-id-registries): Canonical ID formats and deterministic namespace rules.
- [Cape Town Market Use Case](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/trading-integration/cape-town-market-use-case): How a Cape Town trading ecosystem uses ODS-E for settlement.

## Building Integration
- [ComStock/ResStock Guide](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/building-integration/comstock-resstock): Field mapping and example queries for NREL building benchmarks.

## LLM Integration
- [South Africa SSEG RAG Example](https://opendataschema.energy/docs/llm-integration/south-africa-sseg-rag-example): Municipality-aware RAG assistant for SSEG application support.
